Review: On the way to nainital is woodland waterfall. The waterfall is very beautiful. The view if water falling is amazing.
This is a beautiful waterfall and a great place for a family picnic... The view is just awesome and the cool breeze is amazing
There is entry fee to this place, they charge around 60 INR per person. Nothing too unique about the place but could be fun place for kids to enjoy waterfall.

It is  Nainital's local market which is easily accessible to everyone. It is mixed market with branded and non branded showrooms. Most of shops were selling woollen clothes or wool, rates here are better than that offered by shops on mall road. Some candle shops can also be found here. Overall it is an average market and can be visited once for shopping.
Market is good for shopping purpose were things are available at reasonable rates and more variety of products are also available.

The market is quiet clean and well managed .Crowd and traffic is well manged by police. The market is having all varities of products but i specially liked wooden products like bangles,bowls,showpieces.The shopkeepers are all well behaved.There are many good veg.resturants too for having nice dinner.
As oldest market one can shop around for almost anything and if one gets hungry variety of eateries to fill the palate. If you are in Nainital Do not miss this place.

We were thinking of buying mementos during our Nainital trip and couldn't decide what to buy. We saw some beautiful variety of candles near the Naina Devi temple during our morning sightseeing and decided to explore this buying option. Our evening shopping sojourn led us to Barra or Burra or Bada bazaar. We visited 3 shops over there and were hugely impressed by Gupta's and Mehrotra's outlets. Especially the latter had the maximum variety. 1 visit to this shop is recommended to soak in the atmosphere.

Though the Mall road is more famous it has shops which are more expensive. Bara Bazaar is just 300 mtrs away from Mall road across the cross road and it is a much better place to shop. The shops have a better variety at cheaper or even wholesale prices. So do have a look at Bara Bazaar shops before making your purchases.
At Mall Road / Bara Bazaar you may find all sorts of stuff from local produce, to branded products.
Yes this is the best market in Nainital as lot of options are there for local products to branded one. This is locals favorite market too. A little crowded some times but worth visiting.

If you are travelling to Nainital and looking to buy something, you should visit this place which is just 5 minutes walking distance from Naina Devi Temple. The market is having good collection of Garments, Candles, Foods. Don't forget to buy the famous beautiful candles of Nainital from the Mehrotra's shop at Bara Bazar. Rates are quite cheap with compare to the rates at Mall Road Shops in Nainital
I did not shop from this market but enjoyed taking a stroll through it. I only shopped for some lovely candles that are the most famous shopping item in Nainitaal.

We visited the bara bazar recently here there is more posibilities of shopping especially candles in different forms of statues and scented candle attached ceramic budha artifacts to use along with scents poured in water in bowl attached to it .Due to heat convection scent spreads through out the room by evaporation they are many designs of course  with electric attachment also available here.cheaper than online stores .Acrutes;badam, is just cheap here slightly on my observation.shawls also .
This is one place where u can anything u require for your daily need and on fair price and there at some very famous shop like candle shop winter clothing shop and some of very good dhaba ..

famous mamu's sweets is located here, there is good shop for khadi and chicken corner is there which offers brilliant food under budget, tandoori roti only costs rs. 8. Thats really cheap in there.  there is also fruit shop the prices are really good if you want fruits to your home  he (muslim guy) will pack it accordingly.
Small & limited options. Bargain market. All general stuffs. No special variety.. It's okay if you skip it.

We turned from the tibetan market to this place. This market is well known for locals who do shopping at this place there are some reasonable shoe shops,Candle Shop,Bakery,Desert Shop,fast food place on very fresh and reasonable price,if you like to walk then its worth to visit and save some money in eating and shopping.

This market is very well known for locals who do shopping at this place there are some reasonable shoe shops,Candle Shop,Bakery,Desert Shop,Saloon,and bank ATM and some good vegetable and meat shops,with good fast food place on very fresh and reasonable price,if you like to walk then its worth to visit and save some money in eating and shopping.

This place is okay if you want to buy some local stuff, candles or souvenirs as the prices are more reasonable than mall road. Few restaurants are also there n the food is cheaper than at the mall road. All in all an okay place.

This essentially a market place for the locals, though there are hotels and restaurants catering to the needs of the tourist. If you are looking for freshly made Kumaoni sweets and other local delicacies; this is the best place to be in Nainital. The Bazar is at the beginning of the climb of Mallital.

Bada Bazaar is in Mallital. After roaming in the Tibetan Market, we decided to see bada bazaar. This place is studded with a lot of economic hotels and restaurants. Remember to bargain whatever you buy from here.

You must have buy small products to decorate your home and to have a memorable item that you can say i had bought this item from nainital. I had bought some craft like a rikhsha a bicycle and some tiny bicycle keying that are made of single wire . A great experience.
This is a very good market for tourists. here one can find the same branded clothes at very low prices. the quality is good. its a main attractions near Naina devi temple. here u can get good food..
Located in the midst of Nainital city/ next to Naina Devi temple and offers great shopping options at right price for all.

This is the main market area present at the northern end of the lake(Mallitaal) where everything is available. Check out for enticing shawls, woolens, jackets, candles, wooden artifacts. Stoles are available from INR 100 ( Example: Sunny's Collection). The shopkeeper 'Firoz' turned out to be a friendly lad!Candles from INR 10. Wooden artifacts from INR 30.Jackets are available from INR 800. Though I found a particular jacket for INR 550 being sold at various shops in the Tibetan Market. Colors are very fluorescent in nature. Shops selling tasty chicken rolls and other eateries, vegetables, flowers for offering in Puja all are present!

This place is just next to mall road and naini lake. There are lots of candel shops, fine restaurants, woolen shops. The price of the products are not expensive. There are fixed price of each products. Very less chance of bargain.

the place is a must visit in nainital.  I had a really great time here shopping and enjoying the fast foods . The place is so vibrant and cheerful, some may call it crowded, but i liked the hustle and bustle of that market. The items were very reasonably priced and there was no window left for bargain. I bought souvenirs for all my relatives from there.
It was nice time pass, the kids and family enjoyed looking at the things, nice window shopping. I am not a big fan of shopping, but it was great to see your family enjoy.

Bara Bazaar is located right next to the mall road and is a great place for roaming around, shopping and eating on the cheap. Compared to its peers on mall road, you will find local restaurants here who serve the same or even better food at half the prices (Try the new chicken corner for all the non veg lovers)

Whenever you would be visiting a tourist place you would always want to buy some gifts and memorabilia for loved ones, and this place can answer all such needs. Rates out here are decent and you can always negotiate hard. Not to miss the famous candles of Nainital.
It's a market for locals to buy daily need stuff. Nothing much to write or appreciate. Though it's a local market but if they find out that you are from outside they try to charge extra.
One of the best place for shopping at nainital.This place is just next to mall road and naini lake. There are lots of candel shops, fine restaurants, woolen shops.

We crossed this market on our way to the mall road. This seems to be a local market and not for tourist. There is nothing different here. I would recommend the Bhutia Market near by, where much more options are there in terms of shopping for winter cloths as well eating.

I had very bad experience at a store called Prince Store located on Mall Road near Nanak Restaurant. They sold me a ladies woolen wear that had a hole ! When I went to get it changed next day, the shop owner behaved in a very arrogant manner and even said that the piece was ok when sold and we had caused the damage ! How terrible a behavior ! When we objected to such irresponsible remarks, he said he was allowing us to replace it but said  this was purely an obligaton on us ! Instead of apologising for having sold a defective piece the owner behaved in the most arrogant manner possible. We strongly advise all tourists to avoid dealing with this shop. We ultimately refused to change the piece out of sheer disappointment and to deprive the owner an opportunity to load an obligation on us. We valued our self respect more than the money spent on the defective garment

This is the main shopping centre of Nainital with number of shops selling different  items .There are a number of eating joints also.It is    most of the time crowded  with people.Bargaining is common.for clothes especially.Not far from flat .
As we see in mumbai or delhi its a market which has close resemblance to markets near a railway station just local stuff fr d localites nothing really worth seeing

In contrast to the previous reviewer, we found the Bara Bazaar fascinating. It is indeed a truly local market and not for tourists. The other markets we found to be rather disappointing copies of western-style shops, whereas the Bara was full of colourful, genuine, local tradespeople. Deliveries into the narrow alleys were of necessity by foot and therefore huge trunks and packages were carried - traditional-style - on the backs of the tradesmen, using worryingly flimsy-looking material bands around the forehead. It was busy on the day we visited, but not too crowded to spend time trying to identify the various spices on show, cheek-by-jowl with live maggots (a delicacy, we understand!) and rainbow-coloured shalwar kameez. However, when it comes to clothing, the most attractive items were the tartan shawls - useful for the cold nights  in winter up here at 6 thousand feet - a leftover from the days of the Welsh and Scottish missionaries. Worth a browse
Fantastic. A a complete Tourist Shopping experience with anything, & everything available. Shop owners are very humble, with very friendly behavior.

We were on our way back to our hotel in Sukhatal and decided to enter into the local Bazaar at Mallital in Nainital, we found quite a few interesting shops, old restaurants, party shops, Halwai shops, medical & artifact shops, Candles & Umbrella shops and ofcourse Vegetable & grocery shops in the Bara Bazaar!

Crowded place with lots of cheap stuff to buy. You will get a lot of variety here and you can negotiate rates for everything. You can walk around in the evening and enjoy the shopping with cool breeze.
The main market of Nainital, you can find all sort of things here from foods to souvenirs. You may like to purchase fancy candles which are iconic souvenir of this hill station. Bit crowded.

Tibetan Market is one of the old shopping places in Nainital. The market is adjacent to the famous Naina Devi Temple. The market is not very big and it's difficult to walk in the narrow lanes. You can find variety of woolen garments, junk jewelries, shoes, bags etc.and to buy something don't forget to bargain.But believe me,there will be NO guaranty for quality. The place is famous also for Tibetan momo and you must try this.
you can all kinds of beautiful tibetian things . Wollens , hand bags, travel bags , tea sets and many more things . All of them are so beautiful . You must bargain in these shops.
Its doable with mall road. Not a must visit but good to spend some time in eve and if one wish to buy some woolen items. Like other woolen markets, it has nothing spacial to offer.
Nice place to shop near Naini lake and Mall road. You can get good bargains for clothes. You can have boating in Naini lake, visit the Nainadevi temple and visit the market at the exit of the temple.
A place where many things are available for shopping lovers and at good price you can get so many things if you are shopping lover
The only shopping area in nainital which offers clothes and footwear at reasonable rates. They mostly import yhe stuff from china and near by countries.

This market has something for everyone but for the tourist has many cheap things but maybe not of the quality you may want. The fruit and veg part is interesting too, but we really enjoying watching the people haggling over their purchases. Street food available but we did not try these as we were unsure of the contents. Good fun.
Tibetan market in Nainital doesnt offer any exciting or different variety of things, most of it is already there in our local markets.  the price too are on the higher side

The market is loosing its charm . Heard a lot but found nothing extraordinary in terms of products and price. Tendency to go for fixed pricing in many shops may be one of the reason. People like bargaining however if fixed prices has yo bebgiven then they go for branded shops. ...hope the market gainsbits lost charm.
This is very busy market in mallital. If anyone can bargain here, he can get good things at good prices.

if you are a delhite, this market wont thrill you as it houses all items available in markets like delhi hat, janpath, palika etc....however for tourists its a nice place, its a market selling toys, garments, woolen items, wooden stuff and whatnot....and there are a few very nice and famous food joints as well..eg. Sonam's momos...etc.

This is quite a busy market. You will see all kinds of items sold here - from clothes to shoes. And most of them seem like Chinese products and are available for an excellent bargain. There are also a few famous food stalls here - Sonams momos being one of them.
This Tibetan market is famous and crowded as most of the people visiting Nainital come here also...

I found this market is quite decent place for shopping at near Nainital Devi Temple...  Titration food shops &  are showing stuff is easily available at this place but prices are very high & you have very have to have good negations skill for shopping at this place...
Tibetian market place is shopping place where we can buy lots of apparels, accessories and things are there. Nice collections.

Good market at Tallital near Naini devi temple, its is quite mixed shopping for men,women, and children there are lots of woolen garment,food court, toy shops, and latest collection of lingerie available here run by tibetain ladies on reasonable price, but don't buy perfume it's all duplicate,must try momos here.
Close to naina devi temple. This Tibetan mkt. same as you may found at every hill station. nothing extra ordinary.

Tibetan market or Bhotia market near Nainital has a lot of shops. Items are pricier, but you can get good items if you bargain. Good woollen items are available but I believe they are much cheaper in Delhi as locals told that all these items come from Delhi only.

Bhotia Market or Tibetan Market has a lots of shops selling garments and other stuff. Don't forget to bargain here as they ask too much for the stuff. Don't forget to eat at Sonam restaurant in the market.

Situated at the Mallital side of nainital, adjacent to the Naina Devi temple. The place offers a good variety of clothes and accessories specially winter apparels. However, being a Tibetan market i set my expectations too high to find something good to buy, but the place disappointed me. The price was way too high, although the material of jackets was good but still found it unworthy. Most of the shops has a Fixed Price policy and were not interested in negotiating the price. I did not find any thing worth buying here, shops on mall road offer much discount. But still give it a try if Naina devi temple is on your list.

Lot of good variety some things are easily available like Sarojini Nagar market....have to bargain, it's quite crowded in the evening and weekends. Has a good view and parking lot nearby..and a movie hall...has some snacks available .

With changing market trends this market has lost its charm. There was a time when visiting this place was a to do thing but in recent times things are not so good. Products sold here are pricey and low quality. Food options aren't good and low too. Can go in free time to pass it else avoid.
Average market like any other mall road. Not as developed as shimla or manali. Ok kinds to pass time or buying stuff like earrings etc.

there is nothing great .Its next to naini lake if you have nothing to do then you can waste some time here .It may be individuals interest too .I would rather spend sometime sitting near the lake or may the Temple or Gurudwara in the market

A small market, just in front of Naini temple. Market as name suggest is home to Tibetan famous products mostly suitable for cold mountainous climate. Though , commercialization has also resulted in lot many other shops not having any direct relation with Tibetan products such as nainital famous scented vandals, and other eatery joints.
If you are in a mood to shop after the temple visit and boat ride, you can try out the Tibetan Market located just outside the complex.
Tibetan market consists of small shops with variety of little things of daily use,even good bargain make you happy.a must visit place while in nainital

The market is next to the lake. It has shops selling all kinds of stuff from basic utilities to luxury and costly stuff. Even the international brands of garments, Shoes etc are available. A large variety of latest fashion dresses, umbrellas, hats etc offer.a.huge choice one cant resist to buy. We always spend half a day here. The market also is next to parkking so u can leave your materials in car too. The market has some fast food joints hence providing immediate relief to your hunger and thirst. It is advisable to carry a folding hand bag else u may have to buy one there.
Market is located by the side of lake on mall road. All items such as candles, clothes , handicrafts , souvenir items  are available from cheapest quality to branded items.

Well its nothing much but at least a stroll through the whole market is a must. You will get local culture and tibetan food there.Dont buy anything there without a lot of bargain... Buy only if u must. It suddenly got cold in the hills and had to buy woolens for the kids...ONLY IF U MUST.

good stop for buying items like woollen socks , gloves etc. one can enjoy street food like momos , chowmein , soups & sweetcorn . good place to brush up your bargaining skills. one can skip this if not interested.

This is easily one of the best Tibetan markets all the hill stations have. The stuff available here is good quality. Though you really need to have some good bargain skills, especially in the off season.

This is just like any other winter tibetan market in any other city,  Woolens are sold with good price to buy,  there are few shops selling natural flower and wood made show pieces,  you wont find these anywhere else
best place to shop for traditional clothes and wooden artefacts. they even have the unique candles which are so well designed, you wont believe that they are candles.
This place has nothing  special  in it.
It is average market selling  overpriced goods. Nothing special  is available here and hence you can skip this market. Shops sells clothes, candles, food and etc; do bargain before buying.
The prices are high as being hill station but some bargaining can be done.

It is located adjacent to Naina Devi temple and Naini lake. Items are cheap. One can buy candles from here with no bargain.If you have Mall road on your list of places to visit you will automatically end up covering this market. It was so so, nothing so extraordinary.

There is a good options clothes specially for females . You can end your whole day buying and still there would be more options available with them . Yoh can baegain as well there and most of the sellers do go down with your Prices .
Beautiful market on the one side and bank of Naini Lake,all type of products are available at reasonable price
if someone likes to go for window shopping it is good place wherein you will find every type of clothes with huge variety...

Its a small market near parking side clothing, under garments, kids toys, fancy item shop are there restaurant and food stalls are also there to enjoy, there is a very famous momos stall must try, but have to ask for the shop its in depth of the market.
A lot of stalls from resident North-east people gives a new dimension to the journey asif we crossed the border into Nepal. Many of the products like woolen wear are affordable and easily bargained.
I found this market, an OK OK one. You can find better products at competitive price at Mall road or Bara Bazar. But, you can visit it once.

Besides the usual aspect of buying woollens, the various eateries at the Tibetan Market in Nainital are a must for those who dig Tibetan cuisines.  Momos and Thukpa are to die for!  Fried noodles and soups are delicious.  You could try them out at the narrow alley inside the market or in one of the half dozen restaurants that open out to the central courtyard.  We ate at a joint named Hard Rock(!) .... not the real Hard Rock Cafe ..... and the food was fantastic.  There are some restaurants in this locality that also serve the ubiquitous dosas and idlis, but they seemed out of place with the Tibetan setting.  For a filling Tibetan meal at inexpensive prices, this is surely the best eating place in Nainital.  Generally speaking, Nainital spoils one with a choice of restaurants - both regular and fine dining.  But in terms of value for money, the eateries at Tibetan Market take the cake.

The one thing I like about the market is that you don't get hounded and you can look without Simone diving on top of you. They sell nothing amazing but next to the sports arena and the lake which makes a nice setting.
Its a walking distance from mall road.Its a small market where you can buy woollen seaters, socks, jackets, shoes,candles,etc. have some eateries. Its a good place to hang out in the evening time

This is one of the oldest, traditional and popular markets of Nanital; amongst the tourists/visitors. The access to the market is available from the Mall Road , the Temple and the parking/flats. Most of the stuff here as toys, winter cloths , electric/electronic items, shoes etc are either from Delhi or from China; which is in abundance anywhere in any town in India. The only thing that makes your trip worth a walk to this place is the food items; if you like those items and do not mind the low hygiene levels around.
most of the hill stations have these kinds of markets.
u will get all cool stuff in cheap prices..they don't bargain much but price is cheap ..easily affordable and ok quality .
good collection of readymad electronic and other in the market good time pas in market   and small resturent in market for low bazat traveller geting good food in tibbt market

The Tibetan market located very close to the Naina Devi temple around the Nainital lake on the Mall road is a good place for shopping enthusiasts. The place offers clothes, jewelry, toys, cosmetics, souvenirs, etc at reasonable rates. There are many options for food also available in this market.
This is just the place for shopping enthusiasts. You will find some small shops with lots of clothes and accessories, along with some great eating joints.
you can find cheap slippers, lots of  warm clothing, handicraft shops, cheap bed sheets and warm  blankets, its a good walk in to the small cheap shops

You get good stuff here. unlike any other road side market.. this one is good.. keep walking and bargain along the way to strike a good deal. you got to be street smart in such markets. Located just close to the parking lot in Nanital. beware of monkeys. dont carry eatables in your hands.

Even though Nainital has a pretty large Tibetan market as compared to other hill stations, yet, there is really nothing unusual or different in this market. More than anything else, the market thrives on menswear predominantly and that too with a wide array of quality jackets
Good place for shopping and to grab some quick snacks. Situated near Naina Devi temple on one side and Parking at the other.

The market is very good for visitors for shopping lovers where you can buy woollen garments,fashionable jackets,naughty Chinese lingerie's,night wears,toys,and some lovely fast food centre and some gift shop but do not buy buy perfumes all are fake,we love to buy colour candles which is famous in Nainital.

Tibetan Market is one of the attractions in every hill station. This Tibetan market is on one side of Naini Lake near Naina Devi temple. You can buy here a lot of woolen items. There are many eateries for snacks item. I tasted samosa in one of eatery here, which was tasty.
its a good market but little bit expensive than any other tibetian market. there are lot of things to buy there specially wooleans

The market is just adjacent to the naina devi temple and close to naini lake .The market offers wide variety of garments specially the western outfits. The woollens are also very good .Wide variety of luggage is also available.This is a must place to visit if in nanital.
I may not recommend this place if you are from Metropolitan city as we have all Chinese goods at exorbitant price.
Seems like the only thing to do after walking past the lake ..I would say the mandatory ambling for all tourists ..

Good experience in the Tibetian market, you get to see a lot of stuff which you wont get in the Metros so easily. Must have Momo's if you choose to visit the market. The overall shopping experience too was pretty good.
You can buy all sort of dressings and shoes/sandals at very cheaper rate but all items are of low quality. You can say fashionable not so durable,

The Market offers cheap designer apparels, footwears, toys.  I heard this market is like central market for localites. You can enjoy North Indian, South Indian, Chinese, cuisines here. The shopkeepers are hard to negotiate.  It all depends on your bargaining skills.

This one is next to the lake and Naina devi temple....so flocked by tourist, but it is like an average market in any average town, and nothing extra to offer to most people! But maybe there are some people who like to purchase clothes here...India has all kind of people with varied taste....crowded...lot of eateries...

Collections at Tibetan Market is simply awesome. I Have rarely seen such great collections all at one place. While Women simply get mesmerized by the variety.. men can rejoice the feeling of seeing their loved ones so Happy. While this place is mostly for feminine items, men can also find some T-Shirts which they may like.
It is just like any other market in any other city. The place is crowded n the stuff is the regular stuff, nothing outstanding or extraordinary. All in all can certainly be skipped.

The place is packed with great stuff. The prices are very affordable for some great finds. I ended up purchasing lots of winter wear - trench coat, fur hats, woolen funky pants. The place also has some good momo places
The market has good n trendy stuff. U have to negotiate a bit at each shop. Some shops r fixed price. If u like street shopping then this market is good timepass.

There might be  a time when this place might be a good visit but I didn't find it worthy. This Market is flooded with Chinese and Ludiana made woolen clothes. I was expecting to buy something from Tibateen Culture , but could not find it.

There was a time when this place was a good visit but nowadays its not worth. Quality of momos and noodles has gone down. Nothing good to shop mostly China make clothing and toys. But if you just wanna roam around its fine.
A very famous shopping area at Nainitial where one should definitely go for good quality fashion at a reasonable price. But be sure that you are good at bargaining.
This place has nice collection of warm clothes and souvenirs in reasonable price. But they ask for higher charge from tourist so don't forget to bargain.
if you are looking to shop in nainital you must go to this market offers cheap stuff and good stuff, lot of bargaining, good availability of items, good momos, facilities good.
Can buy the usual stuff here. For those "Compulsive Shoppers"  type. Not that you get something extraordinary here.
Market very near the famous Naini temple and naini lake. Must purchase the winter cloths they are very hot and cozy type.

The market is worth to buy lingerie which are good and uncommon in other market and made in China, other than some good woolen garment can be buy form here,it is paradise for fast food lovers,there are several shops of eating and entertainments for children like toy shops,car driving,skating, Video games etc.
A flea (sort of) market where you can find a large variety of items and a typical Tibetan market with deals
A very famous shopping area at Nainitial .if you are looking to shop in nainital you must go to this market.

This market is loacted close to Goddess Naina Devi temple, Mall Road etc Several shops are here which generally deal in Winter, woolen garments. I explored a lot here but didn't purchased anything. Some of the shopkeepers were saying that the itmes are brought from Tibet, some said they are from Bangkok, China etc and some were claiming (which I think is Right) that the items are the same that you find any market of Delhi, Mumbai etc.

Guys if you love your wife or girlfriend then take her to this place adjacent to Naina Devi Temple and she will thank you for the deal. This is a market where you can get a variety of daily use n seasinal use clothes specially woolens. This place has lot more to offer for Hunks too.

It is the best market in Nainital to buy Souvenir for friends and families while returning from the trip. Various types of candles and woolen clothes are the things to buy. Do try Momos at the restaurants nearby....
The only thing attractive about this place were the momos...

This is a small but well laid out market where you get artefacts, antiques etc. what sells most are woollens given the predominantly cool climate of nainital throughout the year. With the Naina Devi temple and the Naini Lake adjoining the market , one should list it down as a must see if only for its hustle-bustle and liveliness on any given day.
the tibetan market is small nice market located at the end of the "mall",

It's actually between good and average. They have got some rows of stores, but compared to many other markets in Delhi, Hyderabad, Chennai, and even Cochin, the Tibetan Market is quite small. And you get to the actual Tibetan stores at the end. Till then, the stores are mixed. Candles, toys, woolen and other dress stuff, a little bit of handicrafts is what is there. None of them, unavailable outside Nainital, too. And if you want handicrafts, you better take a walk along Mall road. But it's fun to walk through the little alleyways there. You can always buy some knick-knacks.
Its one the places you get on every indian hill station, the Tibetan market. In terms of catalogue, there is not much unique and you will get almost all the items in delhi for cheaper prices.
This is just a name and you hardly can  find anything related to Tibet , its just another local market .
this is a nice place to hang out

This is local Market in mallital near nainadevi temple.all items are generally expensive.not worth to buy from here as same are available everywhere but remember to buy few good designer candels for yourself & gift purpose.
I visited Nanital in March'2015 on a cool rainy day with friends.we looked around the Tibet Market & had Momo's.A must try there.

This market is not as big as the Barra Bazaar but holds something unique about it. Located adjacent to the Naina Devi temple here tasty momos and other fast food are available galore. The shopkeepers are open to bargaining but one cannot assure much success out of the haggle. INR 100-200 can be reduced. Jackets start from INR 800. Though a particular type of jacket is available in the range of INR 600. I bought it for INR 550 after haggling. The shopkeepers are not rude.
the place is for shopping and its really good...cant say that it is cheap, you have to bargain for getting good deals..you will get most of the woolen items and bags....

Tibetan Market is near Naini Devi Temple beside the Nainital lake. It is a small market but perhaps has the maximum visitors - reason being being it is a shoppers paradise. One can buy souvenirs, woolen garments,toys, gift items and what not... but make sure to bargain. Off course decorative candles are much sought after  as they are quite famed here..and .if you are hungry you can opt for variety of fast foods..momos,chinese,south indian etc etc.....The place is crowded but suits everyone's pocket hence gets lots of footfall.

this is must visit place in Nainital. Good hub for shopping with cool t-shirts and other apparels for all. Bit costly and it depends how you bargain ,.,., i will say must visit whenever you are on visit of town..
E wen to see the place and started shopping there, its one good place to buy and spend time in shopping.
If you want to taste the best of momos, this is the place.
Gave one extra rating for the delicious momos.
Overpriced. No seller really cares for customer. Leave the shopping part for mussorie if you are planning to visit

Though all over India in all hill stations we have one similar market selling same kind of goods like winter cloths, socks, umbrella, t shirts etc but it is good to see India helping Tebet in whichever way possible. Also they are not over priced and quality is alright. So I prefer to buy atleast one or two things for me or sometimes as gifts
Cheap Stuff at negotiable rates
Tibetan market is located on one end of the Naini lake, its very close to the Sikh Gurudwara, Naini Devi temple ...
Most(like at 90% of the store) of the items you get here can be found at any place anytime. I dont see a point in selling t-shirts, shoes and such here, but people seem to buy them anyway.
Its seems same as tibetan market else. But to pass the time you can definitely visit the market. But you get clothes and toys more over there.
Bargaining has to be at your best visiting here. Nice things to buy the market is big and nice time pass. Try the dimsums and soup too when it gets cold.
It is just like pandora box, all items are available here, some locally made but mostly China made. Very near to Naina Temple. You have to be ready for big bargain.
This is a very good market for tourists. here one can find the same branded clothes at very low prices. the quality is good. its a main attractions near Naina devi temple
Anything in woolens, a MUST VISIT to Tibetan Market. Despite not being local, the Tibetans shop owners are very friendly, helpful.

A walk through the market is fun and colorful. The vendors are not pushy just sitting quietly waiting for business. The market path leads around toward the cold side of the lake where a walking path will take you on a circuit around the lake. Nice to do in the evenings.
Great place to find high quality souvenirs and clothing, plus good food options. Try the real steamed momos.

A perfect place for quick shopping, the range of products available is completely different. Be it clothes, perfumes, showpieces every thing is available. Please ensure negotiating before buying any product.
it does not have any thing spl.. rates are high & response from shop keepers are not good... Do not waste much time here

Tibetan Market was some 200 metres from our Hotel Channi Raja in Nainital.  The market is quite adjacent to the Nani Devi Temple too.  During our leisure time we used to visit the market.  Itâ€™s an average market with inexpensive winter garments and so on.  During our three days staying in Nainital, with several visits to the market, we, however, became skilled at bargaining and bought quite a few.  The behaviour of the shopkeepers is no doubt, appreciable.

Lot is given about this place. Not sure why I did not find attractive. You did have all those Tibetan  members having their stall selling candles and other Chinese stuff. May be a stroll after the boating. You do have some good South Indian food stalls. Have dosa.

Located adjacent to Naina Devi temple, this market has nothing much to offer other than average quality winter clothes, low grade toys, cheap electronics , artificial jewelry and street food. Price quoted is high and bargaining is common.
Very nice market!! Bargain!
beautiful and very nice market to buy gifts for your family and friends. We bought some candles of different shapes and designs.

Its on d one corner of d lake near d temple naina devi cheap poor quality stuff available be it clothes shoes toys bought frm wholesale markets of bigger cities the entire tibetian market are encroached shanties run by these huge bunch of nuisance creator sort of college or school drop outs oggling at every passerby ya d stuff is not highly priced but not even worth d price one is payin and if they can they will cheat on you period i bought 10pairs of woollen socks the ordinary kinds but it costed me 750 bucks mayb commission included of d driver who guided me to that shop even d eateries r so downmarket pathetic food unhygenic the very smell gets to me avoid is a better word

Can get a good deal on woolens.Lots of bargaining.But some shops have good stuff worth buying.Some near mall road as good as well.Also try a local momo's point inside the market,a small shop in between.Worth visit once.

all the best shopping deals in nainital are available here....Just no tourist can feel that trip to nainital is over without shopping here...you come here and just cannot go back without buying something....all the shops here are good with very courteous owners.
had a great time striking bargains! and ofcourse really enjoyed our maggi and various snacks available by the lake side
This market is a very nice place for shopping especially for buying warm clothes, candles, shoes, etc. This place had a restaurant named China Town, with very good Chinese food.
Nice location, bang after naina devi temple and boating ..get ready to lose few hours and atleast a thousand bucks.. Good options for ladies with all types of dresses,purses..

its a local market by tibetian people where they sell various items mainly woolens, garments,sweaters,shawls, kids toys, candles,gift items etc .Restaurants are also situated nearby, this market is near  naini lake and naina devi temple

the mall is few steps away from Naina Devi Temple...it ll be good to visit there @ evening...take a walk from temple to mall,I prefered riksha after shopping...it was nice...there are a no: of shops including clothes esp. salwar,tees n tops,woollen shawls,sweater,Nainital spcl candles n all...a budget shopping can be done...ofcourse variety of fries n drinks are available...happy shopping :-)
Situated on flat in Nainital this is a popular market for  tourists selling various items,albeit of cheap quality.There are a number of eating joints also.The famous Naina Devi temple is close by.
The place is recommended a lot however didn't seem as good as the hype. Cheap stuff with bargains aplenty.
This market sells clothes, shoes and anything  you can imagine. You can get anything from souvenirs to authentic tibetan food which is THE BEST i have had in a long time.

You have to bargain here but the quality of goods are really nice and they have a large variety to choose from. From mufflers to jackets, we get a wide range of varieties. also the food in some of the restaurants are really nice at affordable price. there is an craft shop inside the market. It has some really nice wooden showpieces as well as candles. Overall nice place to visit and enjoy.

The flee market alongside the Naini lake. It has few shops run by Tibetians. If you are from any of the metro city, the market is not for you since it sells things that you'll easily find in your local market. There are few street vendors selling hand made ladies socks made by pure wool which is really nice. This is one thing which you will not find easily anywhere else in India. Even if you find it, the rates would be much more higher than from that of Nainital.

The market is called Tibetan but most of the items here are expensive by Mumbai standards. All the shopkeepers have king sized egos and attitudes and not helpful at all. The hawkers who line the street which comes to the market are much better and give good service.
bought some wollen clothes. Expected stuff to be reasonably priced. But needed some good bargaining skills and most of lady luck to bargain.
